body_html:
Unfortunately, nope, we don't have the bandwidth to support very old versions of Go.
Currently, we're trying to keep in sync with the supported releases of Go, which at this time corresponds to 1.10 and 1.9.

If a simple code change makes things work with older versions of Go, without sacrificing compatibility and performance with the supported Go releases, then we'd be happy to accept a pull request. If not, will have to rely on community support.

Thanks! Sorry that I didn't give the answer you were probably hoping for!

body:
Unfortunately, nope, we don't have the bandwidth to support very old versions of Go.
Currently, we're trying to keep in sync with [the supported releases of Go](https://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html#policy), which at this time corresponds to 1.10 and 1.9. 

If a simple code change makes things work with older versions of Go, without sacrificing compatibility and performance with the supported Go releases, then we'd be happy to accept a pull request. If not, will have to rely on community support.

Thanks! Sorry that I didn't give the answer you were probably hoping for!
